info.game_comments:
2000 Tournament of Champions semifinal game 2.
From the Atlanta Civic Center.

(1, 1).clue: Named for the third Greek letter, they resemble X rays but have shorter wavelengths

(2, 1).clue: Before his diplomatic career he was an educator, serving on Burma's textbook committee

(3, 1).clue: Arthur gets trapped in Morgan Le Fey's enchanted forest in this legendary musical

(4, 1).clue: She was born in Alberta in 1907, 26 years before King Kong held her in his hand

(6, 1).clue: Like coffee, tea can take on this "nationality" when combined with whiskey

(1, 2).clue: A battery may have a single one of these electricity producing units or have several connected in series

(2, 2).clue: He lived with his parents in Uppsala Castle

(3, 2).clue: Louise is just a little stripling at the beginning of this musical, but by the end, she's a burlesque queen

(4, 2).clue: Last name of Ontario natives Annette, Cecile, Emilie, Marie & Yvonne, born May 28, 1934

(6, 2).clue: Before being sliced or put into a salad for tea sandwiches, eggs must be cooked this way

(1, 3).clue: The simplest of the aldehyde compounds, it prevents deterioration of protein-rich substances

(2, 3).clue: After leaving the U.N., he served as governor of Oslo & Akershus

(3, 3).clue: Attention, matchmakers:Tzeitel, Hodel, Chava, Shprintze & Bielke are the 5 daughters in this musical

(4, 3).clue: Being born in southern Ontario might have influenced his 1970 rock classic "Southern Man"

(6, 3).clue: The longer you infuse your tea, the more of this stimulant winds up in your cup

(1, 4).clue: 4-letter word for the force that hinders an airplane's forward thrust, caused by friction with the air

(2, 4).clue: After his term as secretary-general, he ran unsuccessfully for the presidency of Peru in 1995

(3, 4).clue: Unlike many of the other characters in this musical, Tuptim is from Burma

(4, 4).clue: This wacky pianist who died in 1982 played with his eyes nearly at keyboard level & hummed along with himself

(6, 4).clue: Gunpowder is one of the most popular varieties of this "color" tea in America

(1, 5).clue: The MR in MRI, it's the absorption of energy by atoms

(2, 5).clue: In 1987 he was a member of the Egyptian parliament

(3, 5).clue: Harry Beaton's unrequited love for Jean McLaren threatens to make this title village vanish forever

(4, 5).clue: This man from Alliston, Ontario went with the best, Charles Best, to jointly discover insulin

(6, 5).clue: Not the English, but this colonial power introduced tea to North America in the 1650s

(1, 1).clue: The Wabash River provides part of Illinois' border with this neighbor, also its neighbor alphabetically

(2, 1).clue: He played the brilliant inventor of screw-top brain surgery in "The Man With Two Brains"

(3, 1).clue: In 1501, in the service of Portugal, he sailed for the new world that's now named for him

(5, 1).clue: In "Kidnapped" it's the appropriate first name of David Balfour's Scrooge-like uncle

(6, 1).clue: Hieratica is the finest type of this writing material of ancient Egypt

(1, 2).clue: If you go directly east from the Four Corners, you'll be on Colorado's border with this state

(2, 2).clue: They don't get much smarter than this scientist played by Walter Matthau in "I.Q."

(3, 2).clue: As its title suggests, this Shakespeare comedy may have opened Jan. 6, 1601, a dozen evenings after Christmas

(5, 2).clue: If you want to know more about this "Tobacco Road" author, head for his museum in Moreland, Georgia

(6, 2).clue: Forfex is another name for a pair of these, something a seamstress might need

(1, 3).clue: If you cross the St. Croix River from Wisconsin, you'll be in this state to the west

(2, 3).clue: A Greek symbol serves as the title of this 1998 film about an eccentric math whiz

(3, 3).clue: In 1801, under pressure from King George III, this "younger" man resigned after 17 years as prime minister

(5, 3).clue: Sick of this title doctor, Hugh Lofting sent him to the Moon in 1928, & grudgingly brought him back in 1933

(6, 3).clue: A turbo is a supercharged car; a turbot is a flat type of this

(1, 4).clue: The communities of Morrowville & Fairbury lie on either side of this border, also the name of an 1854 act

(2, 4).clue: Adam Hann-Byrd plays the young title intellectual & Jodie Foster his mother in this 1991 film

(5, 4).clue: This "Giant" novelist tried to burn her first novel, "Dawn O'Hara"; luckily, her mom stopped her

(6, 4).clue: From old French for "apple of amber", it's a fragrant ball of perfume

(1, 5).clue: The Connecticut River forms the border of these 2 New England states north of Connecticut

(2, 5).clue: Val Kilmer & his college friends research interesting uses for lasers in this 1985 comedy

(3, 5).clue: Around 2,000,001 B.C., this probable ancestor of ours, whose name means "handy man", was using simple tools

(5, 5).clue: "Fairies And Fusiliers" is a collection of poems by this author of "I, Claudius"

(6, 5).clue: Meaning clear or transparent, it's often used by writers to describe eyes as "pools"

(0, 0).clue: Early in the 20th century, he took one of many pseudonyms, Nguyen Ai Quoc, or "Nguyen the Patriot"
